ccg-setinfo.name: Necessary Evil
ccg-setinfo.game: Star Trek Collectible Card Game: Second Edition

card.name: A Devil Scorned
card.text: Unless you have 2 Diplomacy, 2 Treachery, and Cunning>42 or 2 Engineer, Navigation, and 2 Physics, randomly select a Leadership personnel to be stopped, then this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

card.name: A Pleasant Surprise
card.text: Randomly select a Diplomacy or Treachery personnel to be stopped.

card.name: A Royal Hunt
card.text: Consume: 2. (Your opponent places the top two cards of his or her dilemma pile face up beneath this mission.) For each of your headquarters missions, randomly select a personnel to be stopped. If you still have nine personnel remaining, randomly select another personnel to be stopped. This dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

card.name: Alluring Spy
card.text: Unless you have Diplomacy, 2 Exobiology, and Strength>42 or Intelligence, 2 Leadership, and Cunning>38, randomly select a Security personnel to be stopped, then this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

card.name: B'omar Stipulations
card.text: Unless you have Diplomacy and Cunning>30 or Leadership and Strength>30, all of your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

card.name: Back Room Dealings
card.text: Choose a personnel who has Treachery or Integrity<4 to be stopped. If you cannot, randomly select a personnel to be killed.

card.name: Biochemical Hyperacceleration
card.text: Consume: 2. (Your opponent places the top card of his or her dilemma pile face up beneath this mission.) Randomly select three personnel. They cannot use their skills while facing this dilemma. Unless you have Biology, Geology, and Medical or 2 Security and Strength>38, those personnel are returned to their owner's hand.

card.name: Bleeding to Death
card.text: Unless you have Biology and 2 Medical or 2 Honor and Integrity>30, randomly select a personnel to be killed, then place this dilemma in your core. At the start of each of your turns, place the top card of your deck on this dilemma. When you complete a mission, all your cards here are shuffled and placed on top of your deck, then this dilemma is removed from the game.

card.name: Broken Captive
card.text: Your opponent chooses one of his or her captives. Unless you have the skills on that captive, all your personnel are stopped.

card.name: Cave-In
card.text: Consume: 1. (Your opponent places the top card of his or her dilemma pile face up beneath this mission.) Unless you have 2 Engineer and Transporters or Geology, Officer, and Strength>35, randomly select two personnel to return to their owner's hand.

card.name: Counterinsurgency Program
card.text: Your opponent discards any number of event or equipment cards from hand and names a skill (except Acquisiton, Intelligence, Law or Telepathy) for each one. Unless you have those skills, all your personnel are stopped.

card.name: Dealing With Pressure
card.text: Randomly select three personnel. Unless one of those personnel has an attribute>6, all three are stopped.

card.name: Echo Papa Stasis Field
card.text: Randomly select an Officer or Security personnel to be stopped.

card.name: Formal Hearing
card.text: For each event your opponent commands in his or her core, this dilemma is cost-1. Unless you have Diplomacy, Intelligence, 2 Programming and Cunning>38 or 2 Honor, Law, and 2 Officer, randomly select three personnel to be stopped.

card.name: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner?
card.text: Choose a personnel who has Diplomacy or Integrity>6 to be stopped. If you cannot, randomly select a personnel to be killed.

card.name: Harsh Conditions
card.text: For each headquarters mission you command, your opponent names a skill. Place this dilemma on this mission. While your personnel is facing a dilemma, he or she cannot use those skills. At the end of this mission attempt, this dilemma is overcome.

card.name: In the Way
card.text: Randomly select a personnel. If that personnel has a skill listed in this mission's requirements (or any alternate requirements listed in the game text you are using to attempt it), he or she is stopped.

card.name: In Training
card.text: Consume: 2. (Your opponent places the top card of his or her dilemma pile face up beneath this mission.) Randomly select a personnel who costs 1 or 2. All other personnel who cost 1 or 2 are stopped.

card.name: Lack of Preparation
card.text: Unless you have the skills needed to complete this mission, this dilemma and all remaining dilemmas you have not yet faced return to their owner's dilemma pile.

card.name: Language Barrier
card.text: Unless you have Anthropology and Leadership or 2 Diplomacy and Integrity>30, randomly stop two personnel for each headquarters mission you command.

card.name: On Foreign Ground
card.text: Unless you command an event in your core, your opponent chooses a personnel to be killed for each headquarters mission you command. If you have at least one card in your hand, you may discard your hand to prevent this.

card.name: Renegade Ambush
card.text: Consume: 1. (Your opponent places the top card of his or her dilemma pile face up beneath this mission.) Choose one of your personnel to be killed. If your opponent commands a Jem'Hadar, randomly select that personnel instead.

card.name: Short Circuit
card.text: Unless you have Engineer and 2 Physics or 2 Programming and Science, all of your personnel are stopped and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

card.name: Side by Side
card.text: Your opponent names a skill. Randomly select two personnel. Each of those personnel that has that skill is stopped.

card.name: Talosian Trial
card.text: Consume: 1. (Your opponent places the top card of his or her dilemma pile face up beneath this mission.) Your opponent takes one of his or her planet dilemmas that is overcome beneath one of your missions and places it face down on top of his or her stack of chosen dilemmas.

card.name: Test of Wisdom
card.text: Unless you have Anthropology, 2 Archaeology, and Integrity>38 or 2 Honor and 2 Officer, all your Treachery personnel are stopped.

card.name: The Dreamer and the Dream
card.text: Place this dilemma on this mission. At the end of this turn, this dilemma is overcome. If at that time this mission has not been completed, its owner discards his or her hand.

card.name: Tsiolkovsky Infection
card.text: For each event your opponent commands in his or her core, this dilemma is cost-1. Unless you have 2 Anthropology, 2 Programming, and Cunning>38 or 2 Biology, Exobiology, and 2 Medical, randomly select three personnel to be killed.

card.name: Ungracious Hosts
card.text: Choose a personnel. Your opponent may discard cards from hand equal to the number of [SD] icons on that personnel to place him or her in your opponent's brig.

card.name: Whisper in the Dark
card.text: For each event your opponent commands in his or her core, this dilemma is cost-1. Unless you have 2 Geology, 2 Physics, and Cunning>38 or 2 Honor, 2 Officer, and Transporters, randomly select three personnel to be killed.

card.name: Your Moment is Fading
card.text: Randomly select a personnel. Unless that personnel has an attribute>6, he or she is stopped. If that personnel also has an attribute<5, he or she is killed instead of being stopped.

card.name: Emergency Transport Unit
card.text: When your personnel present is about to be killed, you may return this equipment to its owner's hand to place that personnel on your ship at this mission instead. He or she is stopped.

card.name: The Stone of Gol
card.text: Artifact. (To play this card, you must have completed a mission requiring Acquisition, Anthropology, or Archaeology.) When combat begins involving your personnel present, the opponent's personnel involved who has the highest Strength is killed.

card.name: The Sword of Kahless
card.text: Artifact. (To play this card, you must have completed a mission requiring Acquisition, Anthropology, or Archaeology.) Each of your Klingons and Honor personnel present is Integrity -2, Cunning +1, and Strength +2.

card.name: Accepting the Past
card.text: To play this event, you must command three {baj} personnel. Discard a random card from hand, then reveal your hand. If there are two different cards in your hand that you have a copy of in your discard pile, score 5 points. Destroy this event.

card.name: All-Out War
card.text: Assault. Maneuver. Lose 5 points to play in your core. Order - Destroy this event to begin combat or an engagement involving your {kli} personnel. If you win, randomly kill three opponent's personnel involved.

card.name: Anything or Anyone
card.text: Infiltration. To play this event, you must command three {dom} personnel. Plays in your core. You may only execute one order using this event each turn. Order - Place an Infiltrator from hand on this event. (You now command that personnel.) Order - Place an Infiltrator from this event aboard an opponent's ship or on an opponent's planet mission.

card.name: Apprehended
card.text: Assault. Capture. Maneuver. Plays in your core. Order - Lose 5 points and destroy this event to begin combat or an engagement involving your {car} personnel. If you win, choose an opponent's personnel involved to place in your brig.

card.name: At an Impasse
card.text: To play this event, you must command three {rom} personnel. Plays in your core. No player may draw cards from his or her deck. (Players do not need to spend all their counters on their turns.) At the end of the opponent on your rightâ€™s turn, remove this event from the game.

card.name: At What Cost?
card.text: Lose 5 points to spend 7 additional counters this turn. Destroy this event.

card.name: Battle Lust
card.text: Assault. Maneuver. Plays in your core. Order - Destroy this event to begin combat or an engagement involving your Jem'Hadar. If you win, randomly kill an opponent's personnel involved. If that personnel costs 1, randomly kill another personnel involved. Repeat this until you kill a personnel who does not cost 1.

card.name: Biological Distinctiveness
card.text: To play this event, you must command three {bor} personnel. Plays in your core. Each of your {bor} personnel is attributes +1 for each personnel on this event. Order - Place a personnel you command but do not own on this event.

card.name: Captain on the Bridge
card.text: Plays in your core. You may play a Commander that corresponds with your ship aboard that ship. When you do, he or she is cost -1.

card.name: Caught in the Act
card.text: Capture. Plays in your core. Order - Stop two of your {car} personnel present together with an opponent's personnel at a non-headquarters mission to reveal the top card of that opponent's deck. If it is a personnel that opponent does not command, place him in your brig. (That opponent now commands him or her.) Otherwise, the opponent draws that card. You may do this only once each turn.

card.name: Collateral Damage
card.text: Assault. Maneuver. Plays in your core. Order - Destroy this event to begin combat or an engagement involving your Jem'Hadar. If you win, randomly kill an opponent's personnel involved. That opponent discards cards from the top of his or her deck equal to that personnel's cost.

card.name: Deep Hatred
card.text: To play this event, you must command three {rom} personnel. Examine your opponent's discard pile and choose an interrupt to remove from the game. Then examine his or her hand and deck and remove each copy of that interrupt from the game. He or she shuffles and replaces his or her deck. Destroy this event.

card.name: Deploy the Fleet
card.text: Score 5 points for each of your staffed ships that has its Commander aboard at an opponent's non-headquarters mission. Destroy this event.

card.name: Desperate Sacrifice
card.text: Plays in your core. Order - If you command four events, destroy this event to make each player choose two events he or she commands, then destroy each other event he or she commands.

card.name: Endangered
card.text: Plays in your core. When the player on your right begins a mission attempt, you may lose 5 points and destroy this event to draw three extra dilemmas and spend three extra in total cost on dilemmas.

card.name: Escaping Detection
card.text: To play this event, you must command three {rom} personnel. Plays in your core. While it is not your turn, if you command more events than each of your opponents, each of your personnel aboard your Cloaking Device ship is at all missions in the same quadrant as that ship.

card.name: Far-Seeing Eyes
card.text: To play this event, you must command three {rom} personnel. Plays in your core. At the start of each of your turns, you may lose 5 points and destroy this event to examine your opponent's deck and remove two non-ship cards from the game. He or she shuffles and replaces his or her deck.

card.name: Field Studies
card.text: To play this event, you must command three {fed} personnel at your space mission. Lose 5 points to revel the top two cards of an opponent's dilemma pile. Place face up beneath that mission any dilemmas that could be faced there. Replace the remaining cards in any order. Destroy this event.

card.name: Forcing Their Hand
card.text: To play this event, you must command three {rom} personnel. Plays in your core. An opponent may play a card he or she owns that is on this event as if that card were in hs or her hand. At the start of each of your turns, place each card here in its owner's discard pile. Order - Place a random card from an opponent's hand on this event. You may dothis only once each turn.

card.name: Forever Linked
card.text: Plays in your core. When your personnel is killed, you may place him or her on this event. (You no longer command him or her.) When your {fed} personnel is facing a dilemma, you may place a personnel from this even in his or her owner's discard pile to make that {fed} personnel gain a skill from that discarded personnel until the end of this turn.

card.name: Getting Under Your Skin
card.text: To play this event, you must command three {rom} personnel. Plays in your core. When you play an event in your core, you may reveal the top card of an opponent's deck. If it is a personnel, score 5 points. You may do this only once each turn.

card.name: Gunboat Diplomacy
card.text: Plays in your core. When you play a Vorta, you may choose an opponent to choose one: you may download a Jem'Hadar; or each player scores 5 points.

card.name: Hollow Pleasantries
card.text: Plays in your core. When you play a Vorta, each opponent may draw a card. That Vorta is cost -1.

card.name: Holographic Hoax
card.text: To play this event, you must command three {rom} personnel. Choose an opponent to draw a card, then remove the top card of his or her deck from the game. Destroy this event.

card.name: Militia Patrol
card.text: Assault. Plays in your core. Order - Destroy this event to begin combat involving your Bajoran Resistance personnel. If you win, randomly kill three opponent's personnel involved. That opponent may lose 5 points to prevent this.

card.name: Misdirection
card.text: Infiltration. Plays in your core. While an opponent's personnel is present with your Infiltrator, he or she is attributes -1.

card.name: Mission Accomplished
card.text: Plays in your core. When you complete a mission, if you command a staffed ship at that mission with its Commander aboard, score 5 points.

card.name: More Than Meets the Eye
card.text: Q. Lose 5 points to play in your core. When you reveal a planet dilemma from your dilemma stack, it is cost -1.

card.name: Mutual Advantage
card.text: To play this event, you must command three {fed} personnel. Each player discards a card from hand and draws a card. Then you may draw a card. Destroy this event.

card.name: No Escape
card.text: To play this event, you must command two Jem'Hadar. Plays in your core. When you play a Maneuver event, for each of your Damage cards on an opponent's ship, it is cost -1.

card.name: Organized Terrorist Activities
card.text: To play this event, you must command three {fed}{Maq} personnel. Lose 5 points to make an opponent place his or her hand on top of his or her deck. Then you may examine that deck and choose a non-ship card to remove from the game. He or she shuffles and replaces his or her deck. Destroy this event.

card.name: Party Atmosphere
card.text: Plays in your core. When a player plays an event in his or her core, he or she chooses an opponent. For each headquarters mission than opponent commands, that event is cost -1.

card.name: Power Shift
card.text: To play this event, you must command three {rom} personnel. Plays in your core. While your {rom} personnel is attempting a mission, you may lose 5 points to make each of your {rom} personnel attributes +1 until the end of this turn.

card.name: Prison Compound
card.text: Punishment. To play this event, you must command three {car} personnel. Round the total number of [SD] icons on all your captives to the nearest multiple of 5. Score that number of points. Destroy this event.

card.name: Pulling the Strings
card.text: To play this event, you must command two Vorta. Plays in your core. When the player on your right begins a mission attempt, you may place this event on the bottom of its owner's deck to draw an extra dilemma and spend one extra in total cost on dilemmas.

card.name: Ressikan Flute
card.text: Artifact. (To play this card, you must have completed a mission requiring Acquisition, Anthropology, or Archaeology.) Plays in your core. Order - Stop your personnel who has Integrity>6 to take an event from your discard pile into your hand.

card.name: Running a Tight Ship
card.text: Plays in your core. When you attempt a space mission using a ship with its Commander aboard, subtract one from the number of dilemmas your opponent may draw and one from the total cost he or she may spend on dilemmas.

card.name: Shared Problems
card.text: To play this event, you must command three {TNG} personnel. Plays in your core. When a player begins a mission attempt, the player to his or her left may draw an extra dilemma and spend one extra in total cost on dilemmas.

card.name: Standing Your Ground
card.text: Plays in your core. When you are about to destroy an event to begin an engagement involving your ship with its Commander aboard, you may destroy this card instead to pay that cost.

card.name: Storage Compartment
card.text: Plays in your core. When you have chosen dilemmas, you may place one unused planet dilemma or space dilemma on this event instead of beneath your dilemma pile. When you have drawn dilemmas, you may take any dilemmas from this event and add them to those drawn.

card.name: Target for Assimilation
card.text: Assault. Lose 5 points to play in your core. Order - Destroy this event to begin combat involving your {bor} personnel. If you win, choose an opponent's personnel involved and take command of him or her.

card.name: Tempted By Flesh
card.text: To play this event, you must command three {bor} personnel. Examine a number of cards from the top of an opponent's dilemma pile equal to the number of his or her personnel you command. You may place those dilemmas on the top and bottom of that dilemma pile in any order. Destroy this event.

card.name: The Key to Victory
card.text: Pah-wraith. Draw card equal to the cost of an event in your core, then discard that number of cards from hand. Then, if you command three {car} personnel, you may draw a card. Destroy this event.

card.name: The Perfect Tool
card.text: Plays in your core. During each of your Play and Draw Cards segments, you may spend 1 additional counter for each personnel you command but do not own.

card.name: Thought Maker
card.text: Artifact. (To play this card, you must have completed a mission requiring Acquisition, Anthropology, or Archaeology.) Plays in your core. When you have drawn dilemmas, you may search your dilemma pile for a copy of one of your overcome dilemmas and add it to those drawn. Shuffle and replace your dilemma pile face down.

card.name: Undercover Resource
card.text: Infiltration. Plays in your core. While your Infiltrator is at an opponent's incomplete non-headquarters mission, you may spend 1 additional counter during each of your Play and Draw Cards segments.

card.name: VIP Welcome
card.text: To play this event, you must command three {TNG} personnel. Plays in your core. When a player plays a personnel who costs 3 or more, he or she may draw a card.

card.name: We Are Back
card.text: To play this event, you must command three {rom} personnel. Plays in your core. Each of your {rom} Officer personnel is Cunning +2. When an opponent plays an event to his or her core, destroy this event.

card.name: You've Always Been My Favorite
card.text: To play this event, you must command three {bor} personnel. Lose 5 points to play in your core. When you play this event, download up to five cards, then place them on this event. You may spend 1 counter to take a card on this event into your hand. When there are no cards on this event, destroy it.

card.name: Your Fear Will Destroy You
card.text: Infiltration. For each opponent's headquarters mission where you command an Infiltrator, score 5 points. Remove this event from the game.

card.name: Allies on the Inside
card.text: Order - Download a Dissident personnel, then discard cards from hand equal to that personnel's cost. Remove this interrupt from the game.

card.name: Brainwashing
card.text: Capture. To play this interrupt, you must command three {rom} personnel. Order - Lose 5 points to reveal an opponent's hand. Choose a personnel that you do not command and place him or her on your headquarters mission. (You now command that personnel.)

card.name: Chance Observation
card.text: When your {rom} personnel is facing a dilemma, reveal the top three cards of an opponent's deck and make that personnel attributes +1 for each non-event card revealed. This effect lasts until the end of that dilemma.

card.name: Indomitable
card.text: To play this interrupt, you must command three {bor} personnel. When your mission attempt ends, lose 5 points to unstop each of your personnel who became stopped during that mission attempt. You cannot attempt that same mission again this turn.

card.name: Knowledge and Experience
card.text: To play this interrupt, you must command three {bor} personnel. When a personnel you command but do not own is facing a dilemma, lose 5 points to prevent and overcome that dilemma.

card.name: Lying in Wait
card.text: When a personnel is about to be randomly selected by a dilemma, if you command a {rom} personnel at the same mission, make the selection as follows instead: the player who commands the eligible personnel excludes one from that selection, then the dilemma's owner chooses from the remaining eligible personnel.

card.name: Natural Instincts
card.text: When your Bajoran Resistance personnel is facing a dilemma, name a skill that none of your personnel facing that dilemma has. That Bajoran Resistance personnel gains that skill until the end of that dilemma.

card.name: One-Upsmanship
card.text: Order - Download a personnel or event, then shuffle that card and each copy of that card your opponents command into their owners' decks.

card.name: Operational Necessity
card.text: To play this interrupt, you must command two {fed}{Maq} personnel. When an interrupt is played, discard a {Maq} card from hand to prevent that interrupt and place it in its owner's discard pile.

card.name: Outlining the Stakes
card.text: To play this interrupt, you must command three {rom} personnel. When you are checking if your personnel can meet a mission's requirements, lose 5 points to subtract a skill from those requirements.

card.name: Reborn
card.text: To play this interrupt, you must command three {bor} personnel present together at a non-headquarters mission. Order - Lose 5 points to randomly select an opponent's personnel present with those {bor} personnel and take command of him or her.

card.name: The First of Many
card.text: When your Borg is stopped while attempting a mission, discard the top card of your deck to unstop one of your other stopped Borg present. The Borg you unstop joins the mission attempt.

card.name: The Order of Things
card.text: When your Founder or Vorta is about to be killed, kill your unique Jem'Hadar present with him or her to present that.

card.name: The Rite of Emergence
card.text: When your Host is attempting a mission, discard two random cards from hand to make him or her gain Treachery and a skill of your choice until the end of this turn.

card.name: Anneli
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Biology {SD}Science While you command an event in your core, this personnel is attributes+1.

card.name: Bareil Antos (Opaka's Protector)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Diplomacy {SD}2 Honor {SD}Leadership {SD}Programming Vedek. Order - Stop this personnel to download a card, then place that card in your discard pile.

card.name: Day Kannu (Field Colonel)
card.text: {SD}Engineer {SD}Officer {SD}Security {SD}Treachery When you win combat involving this personnel, score 5 points.

card.name: Dukat (Anjohl Tennan)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Archaeology {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Programming {SD}2 Treachery While this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may remove an Anthropology or Leadership personnel in your discard pile from the game to make this personnel attributes+1 until the end of this mission attempt.

card.name: Kira Meru (Comfort Woman)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Exobiology {SD}Geology While this personnel is attempting a mission, you may lose 5 points to make her gain a skill on a {baj} personnel in your discard pile until the end of that mission attempt.

card.name: Krim (Thoughtful Tactician)
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Honor {SD}Leadership {SD}Officer Commander: Talnot. General. Order - Lose 5 points and stop this personnel to name a dilemma. Choose an opponent to take each copy of that dilemma for his or her dilemma pile, place them beneath your completed mission, then shuffle and replace his or her dilemma pile face down.

card.name: Kulan (Militia Soldier)
card.text: {SD}Engineer {SD}Honor {SD}Navigation {SD}Transporters Bajoran Resistance. When you play this personnel, for each event in your discard pile, he is cost-1. While you have a Navigation personnel in your discard pile, this personnel gains Navigation.

card.name: Leeta (Rebel Supporter)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Honor Dabo Girl. Dissident. When you play this personnel, discard a card from hand. While you have more than ten cards in your discard pile, each of your Dissident personnel present is attributes+1.

card.name: Razka Karn (Scavenger)
card.text: {SD}Acquisition {SD}Archaeology {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Engineer {SD}Navigation Bajoran Resistance. Smuggler. Thief. While this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may discard an event from hand to replace his Integrity with the Integrity of a {baj} personnel in your discard pile until the end of that dilemma.

card.name: Solbor (Faithful Attendant)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Exobiology {SD}Honor Prylar. When you complete a mission involving this personnel, if your Kai, other Prylar, or Vedek used a skill to complete it, score 5 points.

card.name: Surmak Ren (Medical Administrator)
card.text: {SD}Biology {SD}Leadership {SD}Medical {SD}Programming {SD}Science Bajoran Resistance. When you play this personnel, each opponent discards a card from hand for each headquarters mission he or she commands.

card.name: Treyam (Militia Soldier)
card.text: {SD}Archaeology {SD}Medical {SD}Physics {SD}Programming Bajoran Resistance. When you play this personnel, for each event in your discard pile, he is cost-1. While you have a Medical personnel in your discard pile, this personnel gains Medical.

card.name: Defragmentation Drone
card.text: {SD}Physics {SD}Security Drone. Order - Destroy an event in your core to draw cards equal to that event's cost.

card.name: Examination Drone
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Archaeology {SD}Astrometrics Drone. When you play this personnel, choose an opponent. You may draw a card for each headquarters mission he or she commands.

card.name: Facilitation Drone
card.text: {SD}Biology {SD}Geology {SD}Medical {SD}Programming Drone. When you play this personnel, you may reveal up to three cards from the bottom of your deck. As your next action, you may play one of those cards as if it were in your hand. Those you do not play are placed in your discard pile.

card.name: Five of Twelve (Secondary Adjunct of Trimatrix 942)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Biology {SD}Engineer {SD}Navigation {SD}Programming Drone. When you fail a mission attempt involving this personnel, he is not stopped.

card.name: Reconnaissance Drone
card.text: {SD}Exobiology {SD}Navigation {SD}Security {SD}Transporters Drone. When you play this personnel, you may download a non-Drone personnel, then place that personnel on top of your deck.

card.name: Aamin Marritza (Honorable Patriot)
card.text: {SD}2 Honor {SD}Programming While this personnel is attempting a mission, you may discard an event from hand to make him gain a skill of your choice that he does not already have until the end of that mission attempt. You may do this only once each turn.

card.name: Broca (Grovelling Lackey)
card.text: {SD}Archaeology {SD}Engineer {SD}Officer {SD}Transporters {SD}Treachery Legate. Order - Discard a card from hand and reveal an event from hand to download a copy of that event. You may do this only once each turn.

card.name: Hogue (Student of Political Ethics)
card.text: {SD}Honor {SD}Leadership {SD}Navigation Dissident. Order - Discard the top card of your deck to make this personnel gain Science until the end of this turn. You may do this only once each turn.

card.name: Kira Nerys (Iliana Ghemor)
card.text: {SD}Honor {SD}Programming {SD}Security Dissident. Order - Lose 5 points and stop this personnel to download up to three Dissident personnel, then place them on a headquarters mission where they could be played.

card.name: Mila (Trusted Confidante)
card.text: {SD}Biology {SD}Honor {SD}Intelligence {SD}Medical Dissident. When an interrupt is played, you may kill this personnel to prevent that interrupt and place it in its owner's discard pile.

card.name: Odo (Impartial Investigator)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Exobiology {SD}Honor {SD}Law {SD}Security Shape-shifter. Order - If this personnel is at a non-headquarters mission, lose 5 points and stop him to place an opponent's non-Honor personnel present in your brig.

card.name: Rusot (Proud Nationalist)
card.text: {SD}Biology {SD}Geology {SD}Officer {SD}Treachery Dissident. Gul. While you command more events in your core than each of your opponents, this personnel gains Leadership and Security.

card.name: Seskal (Comrade in Arms)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Officer {SD}Science Dissident. Glinn. While you command more events in your core than each of your opponents, this personnel cannot be stopped by dilemmas.

card.name: Toran (Ambitious Brute)
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Officer {SD}Physics {SD}2 Treachery Assassin. Gul. Order - Discard a personnel from hand and return this personnel to his owner's hand to kill an opponent's personnel present who has a skill that discarded personnel has.

card.name: Amar'itak
card.text: {SD}Exobiology {SD}Geology {SD}Security When you play this personnel, if you command a Vorta, choose an opponent. You may draw a card for each headquarters mission he or she commands.

card.name: Founder Architect
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Law Founder. Shape-shifter. While this personnel is attempting a mission, he is attributes+1 for each event in each player's core (limit+5).

card.name: Leyton Founder (Hostile Operative)
card.text: {SD}Biology {SD}Intelligence {SD}Leadership {SD}Officer {SD}Security {SD}Treachery Founder. Infiltrator. Shape-shifter. When you are about to play an Infiltration event, if this personnel is at an opponent's mission, that event is cost-1.

card.name: Luaran (Cautious Inspector)
card.text: {SD}Biology {SD}Engineer {SD}Physics {SD}Science {SD}Treachery When you play this personnel, if you command a Jem'Hadar, you may draw a card for each space mission you command.

card.name: O'Brien Founder (Agent Provocateur)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Engineer {SD}Intelligence {SD}Treachery Founder. Infiltrator. Shape-shifter. When you play this personnel, you may download an Infiltration card.

card.name: Odo Founder (Adept Imposter)
card.text: {SD}Engineer {SD}Programming {SD}Security {SD}Treachery Founder. Infiltrator. Shape-shifter. When you are about to place an Infiltration card in your discard pile, if this personnel is present with an opponent's personnel, you may place that Infiltration card on top of your deck instead.

card.name: Rodak'koden
card.text: {SD}Honor {SD}Physics {SD}Security {SD}Transporters When you play this personnel, if you command a Vorta, you may draw two cards, then discard three cards from hand (only discard two if you command an event in your core).

card.name: Weyoun (Warship Commander)
card.text: {SD}Leadership {SD}Navigation {SD}2 Treachery Commander: Tenak'talar. When an engagement involving your {car} ship or {dom} ship begins at this mission, if this personnel is aboard a ship, that ship may join that engagement.

card.name: Beverly Crusher (Chief Physician)
card.text: {SD}Biology {SD}Exobiology {SD}2 Medical When this personnel is stopped by a dilemma, you may take a {TNG} personnel from your discard pile into hand.

card.name: Data (Pinocchio)
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Engineer {SD}Exobiology {SD}Officer {SD}Programming When you play this personnel, name Anthropology, Navigation or Physics. This personnel gains that skill.

card.name: Deanna Troi (Ship's Counselor)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Honor {SD}Telepathy Order - If this personnel is present with an opponent's personnel, stop this personnel to examine that opponent's hand and choose a card to place on the bottom of his or her deck.

card.name: Dorian Collins (Acting Chief Petty Officer)
card.text: Cadet. While this personnel is facing a dilemma, she is attributes+1 and gains Anthropology, Engineer, Geology, Honor and Transporters.

card.name: Geordi La Forge (Conn Officer)
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Navigation {SD}Officer While this personnel is on a planet, he loses Astrometrics, Navigation and Officer and gains Engineer, Physics and Programming.

card.name: Guinan (Listener)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Exobiology {SD}2 Honor When you play this personnel, each player scores 5 points.

card.name: Jadzia Dax (Problem Solver)
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Physics {SD}Programming {SD}Science Host. When you are about to place an event in your discard pile, you may stop this personnel to place it on the bottom of your deck instead.

card.name: Jake Sisko (Reporter Behind the Lines)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Biology {SD}Honor {SD}Programming Dissident. When you play this personnel, discard a card from hand. When you play another Dissident personnel, you may make each player discard the top card of his or her deck.

card.name: Kalita (Maquis Pilot)
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Biology {SD}Navigation When you play this personnel, you may place an opponent's even on top of its owner's deck.

card.name: Karen Farris (Rigorous Leader)
card.text: Cadet. While this personnel is facing a dilemma, she is attributes+1 and gains Astrometrics, Engineer, Leadership, Officer, and Security.

card.name: Lenara Kahn (Wormhole Theorist)
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Engineer {SD}Physics {SD}Science Host. When you play this personnel, you may examine the top four cards of your deck. You may reveal one event and take it into hand. Place the remaining cards on the bottom of your deck in any order.

card.name: Miles O'Brien (Repair Chief)
card.text: {SD}2 Engineer {SD}Honor {SD}Programming {SD}Transporters When your event is about to be destroyed by an opponent, you may discard an event from hand to prevent that.

card.name: Riley Shepard (Confident Cadet)
card.text: Cadet. While this personnel is facing a dilemma, he is attributes+1 and gains Biology, 2 Navigation, Programming and Security.

card.name: Seth Matthews (Red Squad Cadet)
card.text: Cadet. While this personnel is facing a dilemma, he gains Exobiology and Science.

card.name: Tamal (Technician)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Engineer {SD}Science While this personnel is attempting a mission, you may discard a {Maq} Leadership personnel from hand to make a personnel present attributes+1 until the end of that mission attempt.

card.name: Tim Watters (Valiant Captain)
card.text: Cadet. Commander: U.S.S. Valiant. While this personnel is facing a dilemma, he is attributes+1 and gains Diplomacy, 2 Leadership, Officer and Physics.

card.name: William T. Riker (First Officer)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Leadership {SD}Navigation {SD}Officer When this personnel is about to be stopped by a dilemma, you may unstop one of your stopped {TNG} personnel present. That personnel joins this mission attempt.

card.name: Worf (Conn Officer)
card.text: {SD}Honor {SD}Navigation {SD}Officer {SD}Security Order - Destroy your event to exchange a dilemma beneath your mission with the top card of its owner's dilemma pile.

card.name: B'Etor (Ambitious Renegade)
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Leadership {SD}Programming {SD}Science {SD}2 Treachery When you play this personnel, reveal cards from the top of your deck equal to the cost of an event in your core. Take each Treachery personnel revealed into your hand. Replace the remaining cards in the same order.

card.name: Jadzia Dax (Sworn Ally)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Physics {SD}Science Host. While this personnel is present with an Honor Klingon, she is attributes+1 and gains Honor.

card.name: K'Tal (Senior Council Member)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Law High Council Member. When you play a Chancellor or High Council Member at this mission, you may download an event.

card.name: Lursa (Ambitious Renegade)
card.text: {SD}Engineer {SD}Leadership {SD}Navigation {SD}2 Treachery When you play this personnel, reveal cards from the top of your deck equal to the cost of an event into your core. Take each Assault and Maneuver card revealed into your hand. Replace the remaining cards in the same order.

card.name: William T. Riker (Exchange Officer)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Leadership {SD}Navigation {SD}Officer While this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may discard a card from hand to make him gain a skill from your Klingon present until the end of that mission attempt.

card.name: Aaron Conor (Born Leader)
card.text: {SD}Diplomacy {SD}2 Honor {SD}Leadership Genetically Enhanced. When you play this personnel, choose an opponent. For each headquarters mission he or she commands, this personnel is cost-1.

card.name: Crosis (Fanatical Lieutenant)
card.text: {SD}Exobiology {SD}Officer {SD}Programming {SD}Security {SD}Treachery For each event you command beyond the number of events an opponent of your choice commands, this personnel is attributes+1 (limit+6).

card.name: Data (Loyal Brother)
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Biology {SD}Engineer {SD}2 Programming {SD}Treachery At the start of each of your turns, you must discard an event from hand or stop this personnel.

card.name: Goval (Follower of the One)
card.text: {SD}Archaeology {SD}Geology {SD}Science While this personnel is attempting a mission, you may discard an equipment or event card from hand to make his attributes+2 until end of this turn.

card.name: Hannah Bates (Biosphere Expert)
card.text: {SD}Engineer {SD}Physics {SD}Programming {SD}Science Genetically Enhanced.

card.name: Lore (The One)
card.text: {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Engineer {SD}Leadership {SD}Programming {SD}Security {SD}2 Treachery While this personnel is facing a dilemma, he cannot be stopped.

card.name: Martin Benbeck (Strict Interpreter)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Honor {SD}Law {SD}Security Genetically Enhanced. When you play this personnel, choose an opponent. You may draw a card for each headquarters mission he or she commands.

card.name: Morik
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Engineer {SD}Medical {SD}Transporters The cost of the event in your core that has the highest cost is added to this personnel's attributes.

card.name: Reide
card.text: {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Exobiology {SD}Physics Order - Discard two {Maq} cards from hand to place two random cards from an opponent's hand on top of his or her deck. You may do this only once each turn.

card.name: B'Etor (Romulan Conspirator)
card.text: {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Physics {SD}Programming {SD}Science {SD}2 Treachery When this personnel is about to be stopped by a dilemma, you may unstop a stopped {rom} personnel present. That personnel joins this mission attempt.

card.name: Bochra (Loyal Centurion)
card.text: {SD}Geology {SD}Navigation {SD}Officer At the start of each of your turns, if this personnel is at an opponent's incomplete non-headquarters mission, you may spend 1 additional counter during your Play and Draw Cards segment.

card.name: Kell (Romulan Accomplice)
card.text: {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Engineer {SD}Exobiology {SD}Programming {SD}Treachery High Council Member. While this personnel is at a {kli} mission, he is an Infiltrator. While this personnel is at your {kli} mission, you may attempt it.

card.name: Koval (Chairman of the Tal Shiar)
card.text: {SD}Biology {SD}Exobiology {SD}Intelligence {SD}Leadership {SD}Security {SD}Treachery While an opponent commands more headquarters missions that you, this personnel cannot be stopped by dilemmas.

card.name: Lursa (Romulan Conspirator)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Engineer {SD}Law {SD}2 Treachery When you other {rom} personnel present is about to be stopped by a dilemma, this personnel may gain one of his or her skills until the end of that mission attempt. You may do this only once each turn.

card.name: Mareth
card.text: {SD}Archaeology {SD}Engineer {SD}Programming {SD}Transporters When this personnel is about to be stopped by a dilemma, you may discard an event from hand to prevent that.

card.name: Parem (Special Security)
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Physics {SD}Security {SD}Treachery While this personnel is facing a dilemma, he is attributes+1 for each other dilemma he has faced this turn.

card.name: Relam
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Officer {SD}Science {SD}Treachery When this personnel is about to be stopped by a dilemma, you may discard an event from hand to prevent that.

card.name: Sela (Devious Schemer)
card.text: {SD}Intelligence {SD}Leadership {SD}Officer {SD}Security {SD}2 Treachery While an opponent's Security personnel is at this mission, that opponent must discard a card from hand to use that Security.

card.name: Selok (Deep Cover Operative)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Intelligence {SD}Security {SD}Treachery While this personnel is at a {fed} mission, she is an Infiltrator. While this personnel is at your {fed} mission, you may attempt it.

card.name: Setek
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Exobiology {SD}Medical {SD}Physics When this personnel is about to be stopped by a dilemma, you may discard an event from hand to prevent that.

card.name: Tamarith (Reformist)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Biology {SD}Honor {SD}Medical Dissident. When you complete a {fed} mission, if this personnel used any of her skills, score 5 points.

card.name: Taul
card.text: {SD}Biology {SD}Geology {SD}Navigation {SD}Security When this personnel is about to be stopped by a dilemma, you may discard an event from hand to prevent that.

card.name: Talnot
card.text: While you command an event in your core and have a copy of that same event in your discard pile, your opponent cannot destroy that event.

card.name: U.S.S. Valiant (Red Squad Training Ship)
card.text: This ship is attributes +1 for each of your Cadets aboard (limit +4).

card.name: I.K.S. Ning'tao
card.text: Cloaking Device. When you win an engagement involving this ship, you may lose 5 points to download a Damage card and place it on an opponent's ship at this mission.
